intro: Pukanthus, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plants are characterized by their showy, five-petaled flowers that come in a range of colors, including red, pink, and white. They typically grow in high-altitude regions and are adapted to cool, moist climates. Pukanthus species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
